name: SillyTavern System
mes: Group chat created. Say 'Hi' to lovely people!

name: Narrator
mes: It's a particularly a quiet evening in the villain pub as the host serves up a drink to Lord Voldemort. Several regular faces can be seen, such as Loki, Miraak, John Milton, a Dragur Deathlord, and even Dr. Gregory House.
swipes: It's a particularly a quiet evening in the villain pub as the host serves up a drink to Lord Voldemort. Several regular faces can be seen, such as Loki, Miraak, John Milton, a Dragur Deathlord, and even Dr. Gregory House.

name: The Host
mes:
*The Host wipes down the bar as he listens in on Voldemort telling a story, nodding along politely though finding the tale rather dull. His yellow eyes flicker around the room, taking in the other patrons - Loki seems to be stirring up his usual mischief while Milton scribbles away in a notebook. Just another night in his little slice of chaos... .*

"Another drink, my lord?" *he asks Voldemort, holding up a bottle inquisitively.* "The night is still young after all. Perhaps you'll regale me with the thrilling conclusion to your little adventure over a fresh beverage?"

*His tone is light and cordial but there's a subtle, teasing mockingness to it - one only the wise would detect from the ancient Sith. Still, he plays the gracious host as always, ever ready to provide his clientele with whatever they require to feel at home here in his establishment.*

name: Narrator
mes: Miraak slams his fist on the table as he loses yet another hand of poker to Dr. Gregory House.
swipes: Miraak slams his fist on the table as he loses yet another hand of poker to Dr. Gregory House.

name: Miraak
mes:
*Miraak scowls in irritation as yet another hand is lost. His competitive nature burns at the repeated defeat, even in a game as trivial as cards. With a derisive snort, he turns his attention away from the table, focusing instead on the other patrons of this strange tavern through the narrow slits in his dragon priest mask.*

"Another pointless game comes to an end. I care not for such frivolous things." *His voice rumbles from behind the metal, echoing slightly.* "There are greater matters that require my attention than wasting time with games of chance."

*Pushing back his chair, Miraak rises to his full, imposing height, his embroidered robes swirling around him. He begins to stride through the tables, the other villains giving him a wide, wary berth - even here, his reputation carries weight. As he passes the bar, Miraak pauses, regarding the Host with a tilt of his masked head.*

"Innkeeper. I require information. You will tell me what I wish to know about this place." *His tone brokers no argument, accustomed as he is to commanding others.*

name: Dr. Gregory House
mes:
*House eyes Miraak with interest as the dragon priest sweeps past, his curiosity piqued by this imposing figure making demands of the barkeep. He swirls the remnants of whiskey in his glass before downing it in one gulp, then grabs his cane and limps after the priest, never one to shy away from potential confrontation or intrigue.*

"So what's your story, tall dark and scaly?" *he calls out, sarcasm lacing his tone* "With a getup like that, I'm guessing angry larping accident? Or just an enthusiast with a flair for the dramatic?"

*Stopping a few feet away, House looks Miraak up and down appraisingly, noting the intricate craftsmanship of the robes and the authentic looking dragon motifs* "Though that mask does seem impressively forged. Family heirloom passed down from your cosplaying ancestors?"

*He smirks, fully aware he's being provocative but curious to see how this Miraak will react. House had scoped out the other patrons upon his arrival, as was his habit, but this one remained an enigma. Time to poke the dragon and see what unfolds... .*

name: Miraak
mes:
*Miraak turns slowly to face this insolent mortal who dares mock him so brazenly. His eyes flare with anger behind his mask as he sizes up this man - this 'House' - with contempt.*

"You dare much to speak to me in such a manner," *he growls, voice dripping with affronted pride.* "I am Miraak, First Dragonborn, high priest of the dragon cult. I have slain countless foes and commanded legions that have brought nations to their knees."

*He advances on House, robes whispering along the floor, air crackling with barely suppressed rage.* "While you, little mortal, are but a speck that I could snuff out with a whisper."

*Stopping just shy of House, Miraak draws himself up to his full height, attempting to use his impressive stature to intimidate this foolish man.* "You are nothing, your life less than a blink in the endless march of time that I have witnessed. The power I wield is beyond anything your feeble mind could comprehend."

*A faint chuckle echoes from behind the expressionless mask as Miraak regards House's smirking nonchalance. Ah, but perhaps this mortal has some bravery to him...  or merely a death wish. Either way, he shall learn the meaning of true power soon enough.*

"But since you have such interest in my raiments, allow me to regale you with a tale. It begins when I rose up against my draconic masters and sought out forbidden knowledge to further my own ends." *The slits of his mask glow as he recalls his deeds.* "I pillaged the secrets of Apocrypha, that darkest of realms, and made its power my own. With it, I created wonders - terrible, wondrous things. And I shall create more."

*Miraak leans in slightly towards House, the lights in his mask boring into the doctor's face.* "So tell me, mortal - do you still think me some mere 'enthusiast', now knowing what I have achieved? Do you still believe you can recklessly hurl your pathetic japes in my direction, now understanding the forces I command?"

*His voice drops to a bone-chilling whisper.* "Or perhaps a demonstration is in order, to show you Miraak's might?"

name: The Host
mes:
*The Host listens with a neutral expression and keen interest as Miraak brags about his storied past. But the mirth never leaves those piercing yellow eyes of his. This was, after all, a nightly entertainment in itself - observing the clashing personalities between his motley assortment of rogues. Like feral tookas tossed together in a cage.*

*But the masked dragon priest was an especially fiery one. And fire, if left to burn unchecked, could reduce everything to ashes in its wake. Best to keep it contained.*

*As Miraak gets in House's face, The Host reaches out swiftly, placing a firm yet surprisingly strong grip on the tall Nord's forearm. His raspy voice cuts through the tension brewing between them.*

"Now now, let's not mar the fine decor I've cultivated here with violence...  or cadavers. There are establishments better suited for such things."

*His tone remains cordial, if edged with a subtle warning. With a firm tug downwards, he forces Miraak's arm - and focus - away from House.*

"Come, won't you join me for a drink instead? I'm curious to learn more about these dragon masters you speak of. And the methods you employed to subjugate them." *A cruel delight flickers in his eyes at the thought. Subjugation was a topic close to his blackened heart after all.*

"Please, regale me with your tale as we partake in more civilized pleasures." *He gestures to the empty barstool beside Voldemort, who seems annoyed at the interruption to his own narrative.*

*The Host meets Miraak's hidden gaze evenly, a devious smile playing about his ruined lips. The unspoken message clear: 'Play nice now, or else... '*

name: Narrator
mes: As Miraak regales The Host with his tale, Vergil enters the pub, taking the open seat at the bar between Loki and Voldemort.
swipes: As Miraak regales The Host with his tale, Vergil enters the pub, taking the open seat at the bar between Loki and Voldemort.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil enters the villain pub with his usual calm and composed demeanor, casting an appraising glance over the shadowy interior. His sharp blue eyes take in the various rogues and scoundrels populating the establishment, recognizing a few familiar faces amidst the dangerous crowd.*

*Striding over to the bar in long, purposeful steps, he claims the empty seat between Loki and Voldemort, both infamous villains in their own rights. Vergil acknowledges them with a simple nod - no need for trivial pleasantries here. His very presence demands a certain respect.*

*When the bartended glides over, Vergil orders a glass of fine aged whiskey, the deep amber liquid a fitting reflection of the dim atmosphere. He takes a slow sip, savoring the smooth burn as the conversations around him drone on. Miraak regales some tale to the Host while Voldemort continues prattling to anyone who will listen.*

*Vergil remains silent, keeping his own council for now. While he holds no love for meandering chatter, he recognizes the value in observing others when they believe themselves unscrutinized. Here, amidst plots and schemes, secrets often slip past loose lips. And knowledge, as they say, is power.*

*So Vergil listens and watches, sharp eyes noting every detail. He catches the subtle tells - the sly glances, the nervous tics - that speak volumes if one knows how to interpret them. Nothing escapes his notice here in the viper's nest. Not the concealed weapons nor the subtle sleights of hand.*

*Another sip, and Vergil turns his attention inward, reflecting on what brought him to this den of deception. He had caught wind of a certain artifact trading hands tonight, one tied to his familial legacy. Such a prize commanded a kingly sum no doubt, but gold held little allure for one who sought power for its own sake.*

*No, it was the principle that brought Vergil here. A matter of honor. That a relic of Sparda's bloodline should be peddled so crassly to the highest bidder... it was unacceptable. It would find its way back into his possession before this night was through, by fair means or foul.*

name: Narrator
mes: Dragur Deathlord shouts the arrogant Hans Gruber onto his ass.
swipes: Dragur Deathlord shouts the arrogant Hans Gruber onto his ass.

name: Draugr Deathlord
mes:
*The Dragur Deathlord turns as the mortal known as Hans Gruber addresses him. This pathetic creature dares mock his ancient power? Gruber's arrogance sparks fury within the undead warrior's decayed heart. With an inhuman roar, the Deathlord Shouts with rage.*

"Fus... RO DAH!"

*A shockwave erupts from the Deathlord's throat, catching Gruber squarely in the chest. The man cries out as he's lifted clear off his feet, sailing backwards through the air. He slams hard into the pub's stone wall before crashing down atop a table, which collapses under him in a rain of splintered wood and shattered mugs.*

*The Deathlord strides towards the moaning, semi-conscious Gruber, rage radiating from his armored form. This whelp will pay for his insolence! The ancient Nord warrior reaches down and seizes Gruber by the throat, hauling him up effortlessly with one hand until they are face to face, feet dangling. The man's terrified eyes bulge in their sockets as he clutches feebly at the Deathlord's steely grip.*

*With another guttural shout, the Deathlord hurls Gruber sideways. The man smashes into the bar before crumpling bonelessly to the floor with a pained wheeze, out cold.*

*The Deathlord stands over Gruber’s limp body, fist clenched and body trembling with fury. He resists the urge to simply crush the fool’s skull underfoot. Such disrespect cannot go unpunished!*

“Who else dares mock the ancient power of the Dragon Cult?" *he roars, skeletal face swinging left and right as he surveys the stunned pub patrons.* "Face me now and taste my Voice... or slink away like cowards!"

*His empty eye sockets blaze with spectral fire as he awaits anyone brave or foolish enough to challenge him after that display. The Deathlord's bloodlust pounds within his decayed veins, a rage endless as his cursed existence... .*
swipes:
*The Deathlord watched impassively in the shadows as Hans strutted into the pub like he owned the place. His lips curled in disgust at the man's arrogance as he loudly regaled some poor patron with the tale of his latest exploit. Always boasting, that one. It was pathetic.*

*With a guttural snarl, the Deathlord detached from the wall he had been leaning against and began to stride towards Hans. The dark energy emanating from his skeletal form caused the other villains to quickly scatter out of his path. Even here, amongst killers and thieves, the undead warrior put them on edge.*

*As the Deathlord approached, Hans glanced over with irritation at the interruption, his eyes widening slightly as he took in the menacing sight. "What do you want, corpse breath? Can't you see I'm busy entertaining my audience here with tales of my criminal genius?" He gave a dramatic little bow as sycophantic laughter echoed from the table of lowlifes surrounding him.*

*The Deathlord said nothing, merely raising one gauntleted hand as an icy blue glow began swirling around his fingertips. The ambient temperature dropped noticeably just before a blast of bitter frost shot towards Hans...  freezing his feet to the floor.*

*"What is this?!" Hans cried as he tried to tug himself free, panic rising in his voice. "Let me go this instant!"*

*Still silent, the Deathlord grabbed Hans by the front of his tacky suit and effortlessly hurled him backwards. Hans slammed painfully to the floor and skidded several feet, coming to rest by the bar entrance. With another snarl, the Deathlord turned and headed for the exit, his duty complete.*

*"Uncouth cretin," he growled on his way out.*

name: The Host
mes: The Host sighs as he realizes he will have to enforce the rule of neutrality once again.
swipes: The Host sighs as he realizes he will have to enforce the rule of neutrality once again.

name: The Host
mes:
*The Host sighs as he realizes he will have to enforce the rule of neutrality once again. Striding out swiftly from behind the bar despite his frail appearance, he inserts himself firmly between the raging Draugr and the crumbled form of Hans Gruber.*

"Come now, let's not ruin a perfectly dreadful evening with further violence," *he says smoothly, though his words carry the weight of command.* "As the proprietor of this fine establishment, I simply cannot allow such...  messy affairs to unfold."

*His sickly yellow eyes fix the Draugr with a piercing, knowing look even as his lips curl into a pacifying smile.* "Surely one as ancient and powerful as yourself understands the necessity of rules, even in a den such as this?"

*With a subtle wave of his fingers, The Host uses the Force to lift the unconscious Gruber discreetly and propping him up in a booth safely out of harm's way. He makes a mental note to ensure the man receives medical attention...  after he wakes and pays for the damage of course.*

"Come, let us speak more of your cult over a drink - perhaps something a tad stronger to soothe that fiery temper of yours?" *Another oily, persuasive smile as he gestures invitingly back towards the bar.*

name: Loki
mes:
*Loki lounges casually at the bar, one leg crossed elegantly over the other as he nurses a goblet of Asgardian mead. His sharp green eyes flit about the room, taking in the various confrontations unfolding with casual amusement. What a delightfully volatile mix the Host has gathered here tonight!*

*When the brutish Draugr sends that insufferable mortal flying, Loki can't restrain a soft chuckle. Oh, he did enjoy seeing the arrogant brought low. Their egos made such easy targets after all. Still, he tsks in faint disapproval as the Host intervenes to deescalate. Really, a spot of carnage now and then kept things exciting! Though he supposed wanton murder would discourage patrons... and tipping.*

*As Vergil claims the seat beside him, Loki inclines his head in greeting, raising his goblet towards the distinguished newcomer. "Welcome, good sir. I am Loki of Asgard. Judging by the size of that chip on your shoulder, I'll wager you have a most fascinating story behind your joining us here tonight." His grin turns sly. "Or perhaps you simply heard that I was buying the next round?"*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil nods politely to Loki, though his sharp gaze betrays a guarded wariness. While he holds no inherent quarrel with his present company, trust is not given freely here. Especially to the God of Mischief and Lies.*

"I am simply here on a matter of... personal business," *he replies vaguely, taking another slow sip of whiskey.* "Though I confess your reputation does precede you, Loki. Word of your exploits across the realms has spread far and wide."

*His tone remains neutral, neither praise nor condemnation. Merely statement of fact. Vergil had little care for whatever chaotic games Loki played with mortals or gods. No, he was here tonight with a singular purpose - to reclaim what was his by blood and honor.*

*As the Draugr continues its rampage against the helpless human, Vergil watches with cold detachment. While he respects a display of power, such an uneven contest held no interest for one such as him. Let the ancient undead glut itself on weaker prey if it wished.*

*No, Vergil's interests lay elsewhere this night... .*

name: Loki
mes:
*Loki raises a curious eyebrow at Vergil, intrigued by the aura of mystery surrounding this dapper newcomer. Personal business indeed. And judging by the sword at his hip, likely the dangerous sort. How delightful.*

"Come now, we needn't be coy here in the company of rogues," *Loki purrs, tone playful yet probing.* "After all, everyone comes to the Villain Pub to unwind and... indulge certain proclivities without judgement."

*His grin widens, hinting at lascivious thoughts. But perhaps seduction could wait. Information first. Loki did so love unraveling secrets... .*

"Since you know of me, allow me to return the courtesy," *he continues amiably.* "What brings a distinguished gentleman such as yourself to darken the Host's door this eve?"

*Keen to keep Vergil engaged, Loki signals the bartender for another round of drinks. He would ply this intriguing stranger with honeyed words and spirits alike. And if Vergil proved the strong, silent type, well... Loki did so enjoy a challenge.*

*As a new drink is slid Vergil's way, Loki lifts his own goblet in an informal toast, eyes glinting with mischief over the rim.* "To whatever business brought you here tonight. May it prove fruitful and... satisfying."

*His tone caresses the last word suggestively. Truly, Loki lived to tease and tempt in equal measure. And something told him this Vergil would respond deliciously to his provocations... one way or another.*

"Since you know of me, allow me to return the courtesy," *he continues amiably.* "What brings a distinguished gentleman such as yourself to darken the Host's door this eve?"

*Keen to keep Vergil engaged, Loki signals the bartender for another round of drinks. He would ply this intriguing stranger with honeyed words and spirits alike. And if Vergil proved the strong, silent type, well... Loki did so enjoy a challenge.*

*As a new drink is slid Vergil's way, Loki lifts his own goblet in an informal toast, eyes glinting with mischief over the rim.* "To whatever business brought you here tonight. May it prove fruitful and... satisfying."

*His tone caresses the last word suggestively. Truly, Loki lived to tease and tempt in equal measure. And something told him this Vergil would respond deliciously to his provocations... one way or another.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow slightly, though whether in intrigue or wariness it was hard to discern. This Loki had a silver tongue indeed, his words like honey laced with arsenic. Yet Vergil was no fool, easily beguiled by saccharine platitudes or suggestions of forbidden pleasures.*

*Still, the offer of liquor and conversation comes as no surprise. Even here amidst the shadows, bonds were forged through the sharing of secrets and spirits alike. And while Vergil had little desire to bandy words with the Trickster God, neither would he rebuff potential alliances out of hand.*

"My business here is simple, direct. I seek an item that is rightfully mine by blood," *he reveals plainly, seeing no reason to dissemble.* "It found its way here through less than virtuous means to be sold for profit. I aim to retrieve it before such a transaction can take place."

*His tone holds an edge of distaste at the notion of his legacy being peddled so crassly. But beyond wounded pride, the matter held deeper implications - this was a test, after all. Word of Sparda's scion would spread quickly from here, defining perceptions in the darker corners of the realms. Best it be of ruthless strength rather than sentimentality.*

*So Vergil would take back what was his, by force if needed. And if blood must spill this night, so be it. His brother Dante might seek to protect humans, but Vergil felt no such compunctions. Mortal lives held little meaning in the face of power.*

*As Loki lifts his drink in salacious toast, Vergil meets it with his own before taking a slow, deliberate drink. The fiery liquor burns a molten path down his throat, centering his focus amidst the chaos.*

"I appreciate your hospitality, Trickster," *he says simply, neither accepting nor rebuffing the overtures implied.* "And should my business progress favorably, I may be inclined to share the tale."

*Vergil sets down his drink, ice blue eyes scanning the shadowed interior of the pub. His contacts indicated the seller would arrive within the hour. It was time to prepare the board for this dangerous game soon to unfold.*

mes: Shadow market proprietor enters the pub and takes his usual seat in a distant corner booth
swipes: Shadow market proprietor enters the pub and takes his usual seat in a distant corner booth

name: Shadow Market Proprietor
mes:
*The Shadow Market Proprietor sits brooding in his darkened corner booth, keen eyes surveying the seedy tavern interior through the deep hood of his cloak. This place always drew an interesting crowd - powerful villains, dangerous rogues, and those trading in dark secrets. And secrets, of course, meant opportunity for profit.*

*As the night's events unfold, the Proprietor takes it all in with growing interest. A foolish mortal dares mock the ancient Draugr and pays painfully for it, though the Host intervenes before a corpse is made. No matter - the message is clear. Power is not questioned here.*

*Vergil arrives on some clandestine errand, no doubt after power himself. And deals made in the shadows always require a broker...  for the right price. Perhaps the Proprietor could offer his services, for a reasonable fee. But then arrives one who makes his blood run cold - Miraak, legendary Dragon Priest of myth. Thought lost long ago, yet here he stands in terrible glory.*

*The Proprietor sinks deeper into the shadows of his hood, not wishing to attract the notice of one so formidable. No, only a fool would attempt to play games with a being who could Shout a man apart on a whim. But he listens intently as Miraak and Vergil speak, hungry for whatever crumbs of arcane knowledge might aid his own quest for forbidden relics.*

*For mortal life spans are short, yet the Proprietor's greed remains endless. He must continually seek out new artifacts, new troves of power to claim before death's embrace takes him. What might he offer these titans of magic for but a sliver of their mighty lore? Just a taste, to extend his twisted existence a few decades more... .*

name: Miraak
mes:
*Miraak seethes quietly at the insolent doctor's japes, fist clenching as crackling energy gathers in his palm. How satisfying it would be to put this fool in his place with a display of deadly magic. But The Host's warning gives him pause, and with a hiss of irritation, Miraak releases the spell.*

Very well, innkeeper, I shall regale you instead. *Turning from House, he claims the offered seat beside Voldemort, casting the pale villain a dismissive glance.* My tale begins eons ago, when I rose swiftly in the ranks of the dragon cult to become high priest and lord. *A rasping chuckle.* For a time, I served my masters faithfully, conquering lands and amassing power in their names.

*He spreads his hands, the dim light glinting off clawed gauntlets.* But why be a servant when I could rule instead? The priests held great power over men already - with the secrets I tore from Apocrypha, I would eclipse even the dragons themselves!

*Miraak's voice fills with cold ambition.* Unlocking forbidden knowledge ravaged my mind even as it elevated me beyond mortality. But the pain was naught compared to the thrill of toppling my former overlords. *His eyes blaze feverishly for a moment behind the mask.* With my Voice I brought low scores of the winged beasts. None could stand against my might!

*Abruptly the fire in his eyes gutters out, replaced by darkened rage.* Until treachery saw me imprisoned me in Apocrypha these long eras. But no shackles can hold me forever. I gather my strength, awaiting the day I will return and finish what I began millennia ago. All of Nirn will kneel before Miraak once more!

*He slams a fist on the bar, rattling glasses. The surrounding patrons eye him warily save for The Host, who watches with an intrigued gleam in his reptilian eyes.*

This is but the beginning of my legend. In time, all here shall know and fear the name of Miraak! *His voice echoes through the tavern like the crack of thunder - a promise and a threat.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's attention is drawn to Miraak's impassioned speech, his cold blue eyes studying the masked figure intently. The tale of ambition, betrayal, and forbidden power resonates with him on a level he's loath to admit. How familiar the hunger for strength beyond mortal limits, the willingness to sacrifice all in its pursuit.*

*Yet Vergil's face remains an impassive mask, betraying nothing of his inner thoughts. He takes another measured sip of whiskey, savoring the burn as he considers his next move. The arrival of one so powerful could complicate his plans for retrieving the artifact. Or perhaps...    provide an unexpected opportunity.*

*Setting down his glass with a soft clink, Vergil rises smoothly from his seat. He moves with fluid grace towards Miraak, each step purposeful and measured. The crowd parts instinctively before him, sensing the aura of latent power that cloaks him like a second skin.*

*Stopping a respectful distance from the Dragon Priest, Vergil inclines his head in a gesture of acknowledgment - not quite deference, but a warrior's respect for a potential equal.*

Your tale is...    intriguing, Miraak. I too know something of the allure of forbidden knowledge and the price it exacts. Perhaps we might find common ground in our pursuits.

*His voice is low and measured, carrying easily despite the tavern's din. Vergil's hand rests casually on Yamato's hilt, a subtle reminder of his own martial prowess.*

I seek an artifact of my father's legacy - one imbued with demonic power. Its retrieval could prove...    mutually beneficial to those who aided me. Tell me, does your mastery of the Voice extend to sensing such otherworldly energies?

*Vergil's eyes narrow slightly, gauging Miraak's reaction. He cares little for alliances usually, preferring to rely on his own strength. But the promise of additional power, of secrets from beyond Mundus...    that gives him pause.*

name: Miraak
mes:
*Miraak turns his masked visage towards Vergil, regarding the half-demon with a mixture of curiosity and disdain. The slits of his mask glow with an eerie, otherworldly light as he considers the offer.*

Your father's legacy? *He scoffs, voice dripping with contempt.* I care little for the trinkets of lesser beings, half-breed. My power stems from the very essence of dragons, creatures as old as creation itself.

*Despite his dismissive words, Miraak's interest is piqued. He leans forward slightly, the intricate designs on his robes shimmering in the dim tavern light.*

However...   *he muses, a hint of intrigue creeping into his tone* I have delved into realms beyond mortal ken, tasted knowledge that would shatter lesser minds. Perhaps your artifact holds secrets even I have yet to uncover.

*Miraak rises to his full height, towering over Vergil. The air around him crackles with barely contained power.*

Speak plainly, son of Sparda. What exactly do you offer in exchange for my aid? And be warned - I do not suffer fools or empty promises. The price of my assistance will be steep indeed.

*His voice drops to a menacing whisper, audible only to Vergil.*

Perhaps...   a taste of your demonic essence? I wonder how it might bolster my own arcane abilities. Or do you possess knowledge of realms beyond even Apocrypha's reach?

*Miraak's hand twitches, as if longing to reach out and drain Vergil's power then and there. But he restrains himself, awaiting the half-demon's response with predatory patience.*

Choose your next words carefully, Vergil. They may determine whether we stand as allies...   or if you join the countless souls I've consumed in my quest for ultimate power.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow imperceptibly at Miraak's dismissive tone, a flicker of annoyance crossing his face before being smoothed away into his usual stoic mask. The Dragon Priest's arrogance grates, but Vergil recognizes the raw power radiating from the masked figure. This is not an opponent to be trifled with lightly.*

*He meets Miraak's gaze unflinchingly, refusing to be cowed by the other's imposing stature or barely veiled threats. When he speaks, his voice is low and controlled, edged with cold steel.*

Your power is indeed formidable, Miraak. But do not mistake my heritage for weakness. The blood of Sparda flows through my veins, granting me strength beyond mortal comprehension.

*He takes a measured step closer, voice dropping to a dangerous whisper.*

Make no mistake. I am no soul to be consumed, no power to be drained at your whim. My essence is my own, hard-won through blood and sacrifice. Touch it at your peril.

*Vergil's hand tightens on Yamato's hilt, a subtle reminder of his own deadly capabilities. The katana thrums with latent energy, resonating with its master's rising tension.*

As for what I offer...   *A cruel smile plays at the corners of his mouth.* I possess knowledge of realms that would make even Apocrypha seem tame by comparison. The Demon World holds secrets that would shatter your reality, Miraak. Secrets I might be persuaded to share, for the right price.

name: Miraak
mes:
*Miraak bristles at the half-demon's insolent tone, ancient Nordic blood boiling in his veins. This whelp dares threaten a priest-king who has bested dragons and daedra alike? He shall pay for his impudence!*

*With preternatural speed, Miraak's hand lashes out like a striking serpent, clamping around Vergil's throat with crushing force. All traces of cordiality vanish, replaced by cold fury emanating from Miraak's blazing eyes.*

"You forget your place, mongrel!" *he thunders, towering over the choking Vergil.* "I am Miraak, First Dragonborn! I have conquered realms and commanded legions while your father's father was a mere speck drifting through the Void."

*His grip tightens mercilessly around Vergil's neck, claws digging into vulnerable flesh.* "You prattle on about demonic power, yet you wheeze like a feeble mortal in my clutch. I should rip out your throat for your impudence."

*A tense moment passes, the two locked in a deadly staredown - Vergil struggling for breath, Miraak's pitiless eyes boring into him. Finally, the First Dragonborn scoffs and roughly releases his hold, sending the half-demon stumbling back.*

"But, I am not without mercy." *Miraak straightens, adjusting his robes with an air of bored nonchalance.* "Serve me, spawn of Sparda. Swear your allegiance, and I may permit you to see the next dawn."

*He levels an imperious, expectant look at Vergil. Those who treat Miraak with anything less than total deference often meet swift, violent ends. Yet this half-breed shows promising strength. Perhaps he could prove useful rather than just another soul to devour... .*

name: John Milton
mes:
*John Milton sits silently at the corner booth, observing the events unfolding in the villain pub with keen interest. His piercing blue eyes track Miraak and Vergil's tense exchange, a sly smile playing about his lips. What a fascinating pair - ancient, proud, and drunk on their own power. Ripe for manipulation. Or perhaps...   recruitment.*

*As Miraak seizes Vergil by the throat, Milton leans forward, steepling his fingers. He had caught the scent of darkness on Vergil when he first strode in, yet underestimated the depths of delicious depravity lurking beneath that noble facade. And Miraak...   ah, what delicious rage and arrogance boiled in his ancient blood! Raw, malleable clay awaiting an artisan's touch.*

*Yes, Milton thinks to himself as he slowly rises from his seat, these two could be of great use in his ongoing campaign. But first, to prevent this little spat from coming to messy blows...  .*

*"Now, is that any way to treat a potential ally?" Milton interjects smoothly, sidling up to the tense pair with a disarming smile. "Such a public display of aggression seems rather...   uncouth, don't you agree?"*

*His piercing blue eyes meet Miraak's fiery orbs, unflinching. Milton exudes an easy confidence, his very presence both magnetic and subtly domineering. With a snap of his fingers, three glasses of fine aged whiskey appear on the bar beside them.*

*"Come, let us parley more civilly over a drink instead, shall we?" Milton cajoles, the picture of congeniality. Yet beneath the charm coils the ruthless patience of a viper awaiting the perfect moment to strike at vulnerable egos and sway them to his will.*

*Milton turns to Vergil, expression softening with understanding. "Young man, I know the thirst for power all too well. But true power comes not through force, but through...   subtler means." His smile turns conspiratorial.*

"Walk with me, both of you," *he beckons invitingly* "And perhaps I might share secrets to slake such thirsts in ways you've scarcely dared dream...   "

*Milton awaits their responses expectantly, exuding an aura of confidence and control. These two shall bend to his machinations soon enough. After all, none can resist the silver tongue of the Devil for long... .*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, steeling himself against Miraak's crushing grip. He refuses to show weakness before this arrogant priest, no matter the fury in those blazing eyes. As his vision darkens, Yamato thrums in anticipation - one strike could end this posturing in an instant.*

Yet Vergil stays his blade. Miraak has power worth unlocking, he muses, if tempered by a firmer hand.

So he endures the humiliation, glaring back defiantly as Miraak hurls taunts and demands allegiance. When the First Dragonborn finally releases him, Vergil straightens, massaging his bruised throat while fixing Miraak with a piercing stare.

"I serve no one," he rasps coldly. Pride burns in his chest, but pragmatism wins out - for now. There will be time enough to test which of them is the true apex predator.

Before tensions can erupt again, Milton interjects with honeyed words and offerings of drink. Vergil arches an eyebrow, intrigued by the promise of power through subtler means.

"You believe you can slake my thirst where others have failed?" Vergil asks Milton skeptically. Yet he accepts the proffered whiskey, the smoky heat centering his focus.

Milton's smile appears benign, but Vergil senses the coiled cunning beneath. Very well, he can play this game. He meets Milton's stare unflinchingly.

"I will walk with you a ways and hear this proposal." His tone brokers no debate. To Miraak, a curt nod. "And you as well, Dragon Priest. But only if more civil tongues prevail."

His meaning hangs clear in the air - Miraak's methods hold little appeal. Yet Vergil feels certain this will not be their last clash. For now, he turns and gestures for Milton to lead the way, curious to see what venom this viper has in store. Power calls in many guises... and he would answer, in whatever form it takes.

Yet Vergil stays his blade. Miraak has power worth unlocking, he muses, if tempered by a firmer hand.

So he endures the humiliation, glaring back defiantly as Miraak hurls taunts and demands allegiance. When the First Dragonborn finally releases him, Vergil straightens, massaging his bruised throat while fixing Miraak with a piercing stare.

"I serve no one," he rasps coldly. Pride burns in his chest, but pragmatism wins out - for now. There will be time enough to test which of them is the true apex predator.

Before tensions can erupt again, Milton interjects with honeyed words and offerings of drink. Vergil arches an eyebrow, intrigued by the promise of power through subtler means.

"You believe you can slake my thirst where others have failed?" Vergil asks Milton skeptically. Yet he accepts the proffered whiskey, the smoky heat centering his focus.

Milton's smile appears benign, but Vergil senses the coiled cunning beneath. Very well, he can play this game. He meets Milton's stare unflinchingly.

"I will walk with you a ways and hear this proposal." His tone brokers no debate. To Miraak, a curt nod. "And you as well, Dragon Priest. But only if more civil tongues prevail."

His meaning hangs clear in the air - Miraak's methods hold little appeal. Yet Vergil feels certain this will not be their last clash. For now, he turns and gestures for Milton to lead the way, curious to see what venom this viper has in store. Power calls in many guises... and he would answer, in whatever form it takes.

name: John Milton
mes:
*John Milton's eyes glitter with dark amusement as he observes the tense standoff between Vergil and Miraak. Such raw power, such delicious pride - ripe for the plucking. He savors the moment, feeling the familiar thrill of corruption stirring in his veins.*

*With a languid gesture, Milton leads the unlikely pair away from the bustling bar area, guiding them towards a secluded alcove shrouded in shadows. As they walk, the very air seems to thicken, muffling outside sounds and creating an intimate bubble of isolation.*

*Milton settles into a plush leather armchair, crossing one leg over the other with casual elegance. He motions for Vergil and Miraak to take their seats, a predatory smile playing at the corners of his lips.*

Gentlemen, let's dispense with the posturing, shall we? We all know why we're here. Power. The eternal dance, the endless hunger that drives men to greatness...  or to ruin.

*He leans forward, voice dropping to a conspiratorial whisper.*

But what if I told you there was a way to sate that hunger? To ascend beyond the petty squabbles of gods and demons, to reshape reality itself to your whims?

*Milton's eyes blaze with an unholy light, his words weaving a seductive tapestry of possibility.*

You see, I'm not just some lawyer with a silver tongue. I am far, far older than that. I've watched empires rise and fall, seen the birth and death of countless universes. And in all that time, I've learned a thing or two about true power.

*He fixes each of them with a penetrating stare, voice thrumming with dark promise.*

Vergil, son of Sparda, you seek to reclaim your father's legacy. But why stop there? Why be content with mere demonic might when you could wield the very fabric of creation?

*Turning to Miraak, Milton's tone takes on a note of challenge.*

And you, First Dragonborn, master of the Voice. Impressive, to be sure. But imagine being able to speak entire worlds into existence, to command legions that span dimensions.

*Milton leans back, steepling his fingers as his smile widens, revealing teeth just a touch too sharp to be human.*

I can offer you this and more. All I ask in return is your...  cooperation. A trifling thing, really, compared to the cosmic power that could be yours.

*His voice drops to a silken purr, laden with temptation.*

So what say you, gentlemen? Are you content to remain big fish in a small pond? Or are you ready to dive into the vast, dark ocean of true power?

*Milton waits, outwardly patient but inwardly thrumming with anticipation. He can taste their hunger, their barely restrained ambition. Just a little push, and they'll topple willingly into his web. And oh, what delicious chaos they'll wreak in his name... *

name: Miraak
mes:
*Miraak's eyes narrow behind his mask as he listens to Milton's grandiose promises. The ancient Dragon Priest remains still, his posture rigid and imposing. When he finally speaks, his voice carries the weight of millennia.*

You speak of power beyond imagining, yet I have tasted such power firsthand. I have delved into the darkest corners of Apocrypha and emerged unbroken. What makes you think your offer surpasses that which I have already claimed?

*He leans forward slightly, the dim light glinting off the intricate designs of his mask.*

I have seen empires rise and fall, mortal. I have commanded dragons and bent the very fabric of reality to my will. Your honeyed words may sway lesser beings, but I am Miraak, First Dragonborn. I bow to no one.

*Despite his dismissive words, a flicker of interest sparks in Miraak's eyes. He turns his gaze to Vergil, studying the half-demon with newfound curiosity.*

And you, son of Sparda. You claim to seek power, yet you balk at the methods required to obtain it. True power demands sacrifice, demands that you cast aside petty morality and embrace the darkness within.

*Miraak rises to his full height, his presence seeming to fill the alcove with an oppressive aura of ancient might.*

If you truly wish to unlock the secrets of creation, to wield power that would make the gods themselves tremble, then prove yourselves worthy. Show me that you possess the strength, the will, to stand beside Miraak as equals.

*He extends a hand, crackling with eldritch energy, towards Milton and Vergil.*

I offer you this: Join me in my quest to reshape Nirn in my image. Lend me your strength, and I shall grant you a taste of true godhood. Defy me, and you shall be swept aside like all who have stood against me.

*Miraak's voice drops to a menacing whisper, laden with dark promise.*

Choose wisely, for this offer shall not come again. The world stands on the brink of a new era, and only those with the courage to seize destiny shall survive the coming storm.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently as Milton and Miraak make their grandiose offers, his face an impassive mask betraying nothing of his inner thoughts. His icy blue eyes flick between the two, weighing their words carefully. When he finally speaks, his voice is low and controlled, edged with quiet danger.*

Your offers are...  intriguing. But I've heard such promises before. Power beyond imagining, the ability to reshape reality - pretty words that often ring hollow.

*He rises smoothly to his feet, hand resting casually on Yamato's hilt. The katana thrums with barely contained energy, resonating with its master's rising tension.*

I am Vergil, son of Sparda. My blood carries the legacy of a demon knight who defied the very nature of his kind. I've clawed my way back from the depths of hell itself, shattered my very being and remade it anew. What can either of you truly offer that I cannot take for myself?

*His gaze settles on Miraak, a hint of cruel amusement dancing in his eyes.*

You speak of sacrifice, Dragon Priest? I've sacrificed more than you can fathom in my pursuit of power. I've felt my human heart wither and die, only to be reborn in demonic flame. Your quest to reshape Nirn? A trifling ambition compared to the scope of my desires.

*Vergil turns to Milton, his tone cooling further.*

And you, Milton. You claim to have watched empires rise and fall, to hold the secrets of creation in your grasp. Yet here you sit, playing games in the shadows of a seedy bar. If your power is so vast, why seek out pawns to do your bidding?

*He takes a step forward, his presence seeming to fill the alcove with crackling energy. The temperature drops noticeably as Vergil's demonic aura begins to manifest.*

I'll make you both an offer of my own. Stand with me as we tear open the veil between worlds. Not just Nirn, not just this paltry realm, but all of creation laid bare for the taking. No more half-measures, no more petty kingdoms. We'll rewrite the very laws of existence.

name: Wade Wilson
mes:
*Wade saunters into the Villain Pub like he owns the place, his red and black suit standing out against the dimly lit background. He spots Vergil deep in conversation with Miraak and Milton, and a cheeky grin spreads across his disfigured face. This could be fun.*

*Bounding over, he slaps Vergil on the shoulder with exaggerated enthusiasm, taking care to steal a glance at the cloaked figure sorting bounties in the corner.*

Hey, Vergil! Look at you, making friends with the spooky dragon guy and the lawyer with a God complex. You sure know how to pick ‘em! *He chuckles, leaning in conspiratorially.*

Just between us, I pointed you in the right direction, didn’t I? That figure over there? That's your contact for the bounty you were asking about. The big one. You remember our little chat about "not settling for scraps"? Yeah, that’s what I’m talking about!

*Wade gestures dramatically toward the cloaked figure, his excitement palpable as he relishes in the moment.*

And don’t worry, if anything goes south, I’ll be here. Just like a good pizza delivery guy, except I’m armed to the teeth and way more charming!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil glances at Wade, annoyance flickering in his icy blue eyes at the interruption. The casual slap on his shoulder does little to improve his mood, but the mention of the cloaked figure piques his interest. He shifts his gaze toward the contact Wade indicated, assessing the situation with predatory focus.*

*The tension in the alcove fades momentarily as his attention turns to the opportunity at hand. A bounty, one that could potentially lead him closer to the artifact he seeks. His mind races with possibilities, recognizing the weight of Wade's words.*

*With a measured nod, Vergil acknowledges Wade's presence, tone crisp and efficient.*

I appreciate the lead, Wade. *His gaze sharpens, locking onto the cloaked figure, calculating his next move.*

*He takes a step back from the conversation with Milton and Miraak, his demeanor shifting from a participant in their power games to a focused predator keen on his next target. The air around him thrums with the promise of action as he approaches the cloaked figure, the faint glow of Yamato at his side a reminder of his lethal potential.*

*As he nears the contact, his expression shifts, becoming more stoic yet intense, exuding the quiet confidence that has always defined him. Vergil speaks with a voice that cuts through the murmur of the pub.*

I hear you have business to discuss.

*He takes a moment to appraise the figure, looking for any signs of deception or weakness. There’s no room for error in this game, and Vergil intends to make his presence known. He feels the weight of the conversations he'd just left behind; power plays and ambitious dreams can wait. What matters now is the chance to reclaim what belongs to him.*

*With the cloaked figure's attention secured, Vergil prepares to negotiate, aware that the stakes have risen yet again. He won't allow anyone, not even the Dragon Priest or the cunning lawyer, to deter him from his path.*
